sepia.fwr module¶

sepia.fwr.free_module_map(dev_id)[source]¶

Restitute the memory allocated for the module map, should be called at the end of any procedure calling get_module_map()

Parameters:dev_id – the sepia device number (ordered from 0)
Returns:None
sepia.fwr.get_fwr_version(dev_id)[source]¶

Returns the current firmware version, laser must be online

Parameters:dev_id – the sepia device number (ordered from 0)
Returns:string containing the current version
sepia.fwr.get_module_map(dev_id, do_soft_restart = True)[source]¶

Fetch the firmware mapping for the dll, must be called before laser use if do_soft_restart is set to False, a power on/off is required to ensure an up to date mapping, consult Page 11 of docs.

Parameters:
  • dev_id – the sepia device number (ordered from 0)
  • do_soft_restart – automatically trigger a booting cycle to ensure a correct mapping with no reboot
Returns:

the current number of PQ Laser Device configurational elements

sepia.scm module¶

sepia.scm.get_laser_locked(dev_id, slot_id)[source]¶

Get the state of the laser power line, will return 0 if the power is off, there has been a softlock, or a hardlock with the key.

Parameters:
  • dev_id (int) – the sepia device number (ordered from 0)
  • slot_id – slot number, integer 000-989
Returns:

power_state - is power line active?
sepia.scm.get_laser_soft_lock(dev_id, slot_id)[source]¶

Returns the contents of the soft lock register. Remember: a hard lock overrides a soft lock, so this isnt nessecarily the state of the laser

Parameters:
  • dev_id – the sepia device number (ordered from 0)
  • slot_id – slot number, integer 000-989
Returns:

contents as bool
sepia.scm.set_laser_soft_lock(dev_id, slot_id, contents)[source]¶

Sets the contents of the soft lock register. Remember: a hard lock overrides a soft lock, so this isnt nessecarily the state of the laser

Parameters:
  • dev_id (int) – the sepia device number (ordered from 0)
  • slot_id – slot number, integer 000-989
  • contents (bool) – new soft lock register
Returns:

None

pulse_mode In pulse mode? Otherwise continous (disabled)

sepia.slm.set_intensity_fine_step(dev_id, slot_id, intensity)[source]¶

Set the intensity value of a given SLM driver module, in per mille of laser head controlling voltage

  • slot_id (int) – slot number, integer 000-989
  • intensity (int) –
Returns:

None
sepia.slm.set_pulse_parameters(dev_id, slot_id, freq_mode)[source]¶

Set the pulse paramters for the SLM module the original C-API has a parameter bPulseMode = (1 for pulsing, 0 for continous light). mode zero can cause damage to the laser heads and so bPulseMode is hard coded to 1 here.

Parameters:
  • dev_id (int) – the sepia device number (ordered from 0)
  • slot_id (int) – slot number, integer 000-989
  • freq_mode (int) – index into list of frequencies/trigger modi 0 - 7
Returns:

None

Parameters:dev_id – the sepia device number (ordered from 0)
Returns:the product model and serial number

Module contents¶

This package gives a python API to a subset of the Sepia provided C-software documented HERE. Not all of the functions are exposed, and there has been one critical modification: sepia.slm.set_pulse_parameters has the bPulseMode paramter hard coded to 1: using bPulseMode = 0 means continuous laser light that could damage the laser head. You don’t want to change that
